p: The lack of awareness and knowledge of CHIKV may partially explain the late detection of the 2017 outbreak. In fact, late May was estimated as the most probable period of introduction, while the first notified case was dated September 7 [ 6]. Additionally, the 2017 outbreak highlighted the risk of CHIKV transmission in many coastal areas [ 6], although large cities like Rome might also be at risk of autochthonous transmission [ 15].
